intro: Knautia arvensis subvar. cardonica, commonly known as the meadow knautia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators. This subvariety is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
